content:
• Friday, April 20, 2012
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -3.1%) hit new lows again thanks to bearish notes from Wells Fargo and Bernstein;...

    Nokia (NOK -3.1%) hit new lows again thanks to bearish notes from Wells Fargo and Bernstein; shares are down 26% since the company's Q1/Q2 warning. Wells joins others in asserting Lumia shipments won't offset the collapse in Symbian sales, while Bernstein is worried about consumer interest in Lumia phones (Q1 sell-through is pegged at just 1.1M-1.4M) and a Q1 ASP of just €220 (likely to rise in Q2 thanks to Lumia 900 sales). (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM | 13 Comments
  • MLNX

    After jumping 52% yesterday on a massive Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance, fueled by growing sales...

    After jumping 52% yesterday on a massive Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance, fueled by growing sales of InfiniBand adapters to Oracle, Mellanox (MLNX -6.7%) corrected a bit today. On the other hand, Splunk (SPLK +2%) more than held onto yesterday's huge post-IPO gains, which (along with Proofpoint and Infloblox's strong debuts today) drives home the current fervor for enterprise tech IPOs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MDSO

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +2.7%) finished higher today after Raymond James upped the shares to...

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +2.7%) finished higher today after Raymond James upped the shares to Outperform, saying 2012 revenue growth prospects and earnings power are currently underappreciated by investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • MAN

    ManpowerGroup (MAN +2.6%) finishes up after beating Q1 estimates earlier. Net profit rose 13%...

    ManpowerGroup (MAN +2.6%) finishes up after beating Q1 estimates earlier. Net profit rose 13% Y/Y on modest revenue gains and strength in its European operations, but adds that overall labor demand still remains weak in some key U.S. markets. The company reafirms Q2 expectations in-line with Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers (IBKR -8.8%) shares slump after the brokerage and trading firm misses Q1...

    Interactive Brokers (IBKR -8.8%) shares slump after the brokerage and trading firm misses Q1 profit and revenue expectations, taking a hit from currency hedges. Also, IBKR founder and CEO, Thomas Peterffy - who infamously bought 8M shares of MFÂ Global as it was tanking - says he plans to gradually transition to retirement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • HOMB

    Home BancShares (HOMB +5.4%) rallies after reporting a Q1 profit ahead of estimates, helped by...

    Home BancShares (HOMB +5.4%) rallies after reporting a Q1 profit ahead of estimates, helped by no provision for soured loans. Raymond James commends the results and raises its price target on the shares to $30, noting its the third time in four quarters the bank didn't need to set aside funds for loan losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Predictions of further coal production cuts (I, II) are coming to fruition, as Patriot Coal (PCX...

    Predictions of further coal production cuts (I, II) are coming to fruition, as Patriot Coal (PCX -8.2%) says it will again reduce production of thermal coal in response to persistently weak demand. Rock-bottom prices for natural gas have been a massive headwind for coal producers as they struggle to compete with the cheaper power source.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • SXT

    Shares of Sensient Technologies' (SXT +5.6%) move on strong Q1 results, as revenue in its color...

    Shares of Sensient Technologies' (SXT +5.6%) move on strong Q1 results, as revenue in its color group gained 4.5% Y/Y from growth in the North American food color business and the inks business in both North America and Europe. The maker of flavors, aromas and colors for food, drugs, cosmetics and household products also raises full-year guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • HOG

    Longbow Research tips off that The Motorcycle Industry Council is out with data showing that...

    Longbow Research tips off that The Motorcycle Industry Council is out with data showing that Harley-Davidson's (HOG +2.2%) retail sales shot up 26% during Q1, well-above the 17% the Street was expecting. The sales growth total marks Harley's best quarter since Q3 2003. Shares of HOG hit a 52-week high off of trading stirred up in part by the rosy report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • WR

    Westar Energy (WR +2.1%) moves higher on an upgrade to Neutral at Goldman, citing the Kansas...

    Westar Energy (WR +2.1%) moves higher on an upgrade to Neutral at Goldman, citing the Kansas state utility regulator's approval of its rate order and updated multiples. The firm also raises its price target to $28 from $26.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • DY

    Stifel Nicolaus starts coverage of telecom contractor Dycom Industries (DY +4.4%) with a Buy...

    Stifel Nicolaus starts coverage of telecom contractor Dycom Industries (DY +4.4%) with a Buy rating and a $30 price target, noting surging data demand will continue to push the company's core customers to invest in expanding network capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • ABAX

    Abaxis' (ABAX +10%) hopes for its veterinary medical products business enjoy a boost from Idexx...

    Abaxis' (ABAX +10%) hopes for its veterinary medical products business enjoy a boost from Idexx Laboratories' (IDXX -1%) strong Q1 report which says its veterinarian business posted its strongest organic sales growth in years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • EZPW

    Shares of EZCorp (EZPW -15.4%) slide near 52-week lows after reporting FQ2 profit rose 17% but...

    Shares of EZCorp (EZPW -15.4%) slide near 52-week lows after reporting FQ2 profit rose 17% but EPS missed expectations. The short-term cash lender lowered full-year guidance, forecasting 2012 EPS at no more than $2.95, down from an earlier projection of at least $3.05 and below analyst consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • PGR

    Progressive (PGR -4.2%) shares sink after CEO Glenn Renwick warns shareholders the insurer may...

    Progressive (PGR -4.2%) shares sink after CEO Glenn Renwick warns shareholders the insurer may face pressure on profit margins as claims costs increase:Â "Severity trends in most coverages are increasing and, while frequency trends are still generally favorable, it’s a dangerous combination that can change quickly."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • MCO

    Moody's (MCO +1.4%) names former Pfizer chairman and CEO Henry A. McKinnell Jr. as its new...

    Moody's (MCO +1.4%) names former Pfizer chairman and CEO Henry A. McKinnell Jr. as its new chairman, following the rating and analytics company's decision earlier this year to separate the roles of chairman and CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR +5.6%), which preannounced a strong Q1 and lifted 2012 guidance on Monday, is making...

    NCR (NCR +5.6%), which preannounced a strong Q1 and lifted 2012 guidance on Monday, is making new 52-week highs after delivering the report. NCR, which is also announcing new services for small banks using its ATM systems, says its Financial Solutions division posted a 17% sales increase, which offset declining retail system sales in the Americas and Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR +5.7%) pops after its Q1 easily beats Street estimates. Net profit more than doubled as...

    NCR (NCR +5.7%) pops after its Q1 easily beats Street estimates. Net profit more than doubled as the company reported solid growth in its financial services segment, particularly with U.S. regional lenders and in emerging markets. Many financial institutions are playing catch-up after holding off on ATM upgrades in recent years amid economic and financial uncertainty.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD -5%) dips after its Q1 swings to a loss despite a jump in revenue as higher...

    Cepheid (CPHD -5%) dips after its Q1 swings to a loss despite a jump in revenue as higher research and development expenses and input costs weighed on its bottom line. The company also gave a mixed forecast for FY12, now seeing an EPS of $0.50 - $0.55 on revenue of $333M - $347M. The Street is at $0.24 per share and revenue of $342M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • NVS

    Swiss pharmaceutical Novartis (NYSE:NVS) says it halted clinical trials on a new drug to treat...

    Swiss pharmaceutical Novartis (NYSE:NVS) says it halted clinical trials on a new drug to treat hepatitis after a patient died and a small number contracted pancreatitis. Share fell 0.5% in Zurich trading, but are up 1.5% in the U.S. after the company confirms positive benefit-risk profile of its MS treatment Gilenya.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • BPOP

    Popular (BPOP +4.1%) moves up after beating Q1 estimates earlier today. Profit surged Y/Y,...

    Popular (BPOP +4.1%) moves up after beating Q1 estimates earlier today. Profit surged Y/Y, despite a decline in revenue, as the Puerot Rican bank made progress in shedding its portfolio of bad loans.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • SAM

    UBS initiates coverage on Boston Beer (SAM -1.4%) with a Neutral rating and $103 price target....

    UBS initiates coverage on Boston Beer (SAM -1.4%) with a Neutral rating and $103 price target. While the maker of Samuel Adams beer is considered by analysts as a pure play in the fast-growing craft beer category, intense competition in a crowded field could limit upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHE

    Chemed (CHE -4.9%) dips after posting a mixed Q1, beating on revenue but coming up short on its...

    Chemed (CHE -4.9%) dips after posting a mixed Q1, beating on revenue but coming up short on its EPS. Net earnings actually rose 13% on better growth in its hospice-care segment, but margins were pressured by sales declines in its Roto-Rooter business. The company also lowered the top end of its EPS estimate by a nickel, now expecting to earn between $5.35 - $5.50 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • WDC

    Weak results and/or guidance (I, II, III, IV) from SanDisk (SNDK -13.4%), Freescale (FSL -7.9%),...

    Weak results and/or guidance (I, II, III, IV) from SanDisk (SNDK -13.4%), Freescale (FSL -7.9%), Lattice Semi (LSCC -9.4%), and Altera (ALTR -6.5%) is producing a selloff in chip stocks (SOXX -1.2%), which had been rallying on evidence of rebounding demand. Among the hardest hit (aside from the guilty parties): OVTI -3.9%. SWKS -3.9%. MU -3.7%. CRUS -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +4.2%) shares shoot higher after reporting Q1 earnings jumped 38% as the...

    Schlumberger (SLB +4.2%) shares shoot higher after reporting Q1 earnings jumped 38% as the number of U.S. rigs drilling for oil reached a record. International, deepwater and seismic businesses all showed strength, with international margins flat to up for the first time since Q1 2009 despite bad weather in Northern Europe and Eurasia, Simmons & Co. says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (BRO +1.1%) moves up after being upgraded to Overweight at JP Morgan on the...

    Brown & Brown (BRO +1.1%) moves up after being upgraded to Overweight at JP Morgan on the back of its recent Q1 earnings beat. The firm cites improving trends in its operating segments and accelerating growth from the company's recent acquisition of Arrowhead. The firm also raises its price target to $30 from $26.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • KMB

    Kimberly-Clark's (KMB +2%) Q1 earnings and revenue beats push shares near 52-week highs. U.S....

    Kimberly-Clark's (KMB +2%) Q1 earnings and revenue beats push shares near 52-week highs. U.S. sales of Huggies diapers have been dropping, but CEO Tom Falk looks on the bright side, pointing to "reasons to believe the birth rate will turn from slightly negative to slightly positive later this year." KMB's strength also boosts PG +1.4%, CL +1.4%, which report earnings next week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • AOS

    A.O. Smith (AOS +6.8%) gains after easily beating Q1 expectations. Net profit increased by 16%...

    A.O. Smith (AOS +6.8%) gains after easily beating Q1 expectations. Net profit increased by 16% Y/Y, on strong sales from its recently acquired water-heater firm Lochinvar and continued growth in China. The company also lifts its FY12 forecast, now projecting earnings between $2.75 - $2.90 per share, versus its previous per share forecast of $2.65 - $2.85.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CCJ

    Uranium developer Cameco (CCJ +5.8%) is praised in two analyst reports. Seeing potential ~50%...

    Uranium developer Cameco (CCJ +5.8%) is praised in two analyst reports. Seeing potential ~50% share upside, Gabelli finds CCJ "particularly compelling given its attractive asset base and project development pipeline." TD believes "the improved tone in the uranium market should translate into higher prices for the commodity later this year."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • HON

    Honeywell (HON +3.3%) trades up after beating Q1 estimates this morning. Net profit jumped 17%...

    Honeywell (HON +3.3%) trades up after beating Q1 estimates this morning. Net profit jumped 17% as the company saw higher-than-expected organic sales, with particular strength in its commercial aerospace and Universal Oil Products businesses. The company raises its forecast for FY12, now seeing its EPS in a range of $4.35 - $4.55, up

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy (REXX +1.8%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy at Brean Murray, citing high...

    Rex Energy (REXX +1.8%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy at Brean Murray, citing high expectations surrounding its upcoming asset sales along with a number of other drilling catalysts coming out of its Utica and Marcellus shale plays.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • BLOX

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX), a provider of software for managing and automating enterprise networks, is...

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX), a provider of software for managing and automating enterprise networks, is having a better IPO than Proofpoint. After pricing Its 7.5M share offering at $16, shares opened at $22.50 and are currently at $22.11, up 38%. That's good for a market cap of $972M. Infoblox posted revenue of $80.7M (+31% Y/Y) over the 6 months ending Jan. 31, and a net loss of $2.9M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • PFPT

    Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT), a provider of analytics-based security software, is having a decent,...

    Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT), a provider of analytics-based security software, is having a decent, if unspectacular, IPO. After pricing its 6.3M share IPO at $13, shares opened at $16.56, but have since sold off to $14.02, good for a 7.8% gain. Proofpoint, which currently sports a market cap of $413M, had 2011 revenue of $81.8M (+26% Y/Y) and a net loss of $20.1M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • RCL

    Shares of Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL -4.5%) trade lower after the firm cuts its full-year...

    Shares of Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL -4.5%) trade lower after the firm cuts its full-year forecast for profits as higher fuel costs take a toll. The cruise operator expects EPS of $1.80-$2.10, revised lower from an earlier forecast calling for $1.90-$2.30.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • HBI

    Hanesbrands (HBI +9.4%) powers up a gain after showing a narrower-than-expected Q1 loss. Execs...

    Hanesbrands (HBI +9.4%) powers up a gain after showing a narrower-than-expected Q1 loss. Execs on an earnings CC highlight that the firm saw strong results for core categories even after prices were increased by 20% or more on select products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • LL

    Shares of hardwood flooring seller Lumber Liquidators (LL -4.6%) slide after Goldman Sachs...

    Shares of hardwood flooring seller Lumber Liquidators (LL -4.6%) slide after Goldman Sachs lowers its rating to Neutral from Buy. The firm expects improving sales trends but question if there will be enough operating leverage to sharply exceed earnings expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT +5.6%) jumps towards new 52-week highs following its FQ2 beat, which was fueled...

    Microsoft (MSFT +5.6%) jumps towards new 52-week highs following its FQ2 beat, which was fueled by strong enterprise Windows sales, and growing subscription license revenue for Office and server solutions. BofA (Buy) expects a still-low valuation and a giant upcoming product refresh to drive shares higher. Goldman (Neutral) is more guarded, expecting shares to be range-bound until Windows 8's fall arrival. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • CPST

    Shares of Capstone Turbine (CPST +4.4%) catch the CNBC Effect after the company lands an...

    Shares of Capstone Turbine (CPST +4.4%) catch the CNBC Effect after the company lands an appearance by CEO Darren Jamison on Fast Money.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 3 Comments
  • DANOY

    Danone (OTCQX:DANOY -2.3%), bidding along with Mead Johnson (MJN +1.8%), reportedly raises its...

    Danone (OTCQX:DANOY -2.3%), bidding along with Mead Johnson (MJN +1.8%), reportedly raises its offer for Pfizer's (PFE +1.2%) infant nutrition business to nearly $11B. Analysts say Danone needs the business or it will face a problem of how to expand. Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY +0.2%) earlier this week was seen closing in on a deal to buy the Pfizer unit for at least $9B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    Riverbed's (RVBD -25.2%) Q1 revenue miss and Q2 guidance result in a post-earnings crash for the...

    Riverbed's (RVBD -25.2%) Q1 revenue miss and Q2 guidance result in a post-earnings crash for the second straight quarter (previous). JPMorgan, Wedbush, Oppenheimer, and Cantor Fitzgerald are downgrading in response; the firms voice concerns about product transitions, sales cycles and execution, soft demand, and the digesting of acquisitions, with JPMorgan and Cantor arguing Riverbed's problems could take at least a couple quarters to resolve. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -20.1%) crater after a weak forecast for full-year earnings has...

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -20.1%) crater after a weak forecast for full-year earnings has investors running for the hills. The company says that it expects to earn $3.80-$3.95 a share this year after analysts had EPS pegged at $3.97. Mattress Firm (MFRM -4.8%), Sealy (ZZ -1.9%), and Select Comfort (SCSS -6.7%) trade lower off the weak outlook for mattress sales provided by Tempur-Pedic.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • INCY

    Incyte (INCY +2.1%) lands European Union approval on its Ruxolitinib drug for patients with...

    Incyte (INCY +2.1%) lands European Union approval on its Ruxolitinib drug for patients with different types of bone marrow cancer. The action earns the company a $40M milestone payment from Novartis.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • WDC

    Deutsche Bank is one of several firms downgrading SanDisk (SNDK -12.7%), believing the...

    Deutsche Bank is one of several firms downgrading SanDisk (SNDK -12.7%), believing the disappointing H1 performance (I, II) "is a function of the company being focused on the wrong customers and the wrong markets," noting declining revenue share since 2008 which "appears to be accelerating in 2012." Credit Agricole, Piper Jaffray and Caris also weigh in with downgrades.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD +6.6%) knocks out a gain after the firm announces that it authorized a $50M stock...

    RealD (RLD +6.6%) knocks out a gain after the firm announces that it authorized a $50M stock repurchase program and entered into a $125M credit agreement comprised of a $75M revolving credit facility and a $50M term loan facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • INTU

    Intuit (INTU -5%) sells off after reporting TurboTax Federal unit sales rose just 6% Y/Y during...

    Intuit (INTU -5%) sells off after reporting TurboTax Federal unit sales rose just 6% Y/Y during tax season, with an 11% increase for the Online version offset by declines of 3% and 6%, respectively, for the Desktop and Free File versions. As a result, Intuit expects FQ3 revenue to be at or slightly below the low end of its prior guidance range. FY12 revenue and EPS guidance is being reaffirmed. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) trims another 2.9% in premarket action after a German court finds the firm...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) trims another 2.9% in premarket action after a German court finds the firm infringed on a patent related to emergency services and negative sentiment over its Q1 report continues to swirl around.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) jumps 6.4% higher in premarket trading, helped along with an initiation...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) jumps 6.4% higher in premarket trading, helped along with an initiation from JPMorgan at Overweight to go along with its high-flying $22 price target. All 8 brokerage firms covering the stock have it slotted with either a Buy or Overweight rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • ETFC

    Shares of E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) rip a 5.8% gain premarket after its Q1 report (I, II) impresses...

    Shares of E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) rip a 5.8% gain premarket after its Q1 report (I, II) impresses investors. The brokerage firm says it added $4B in new brokerages assets and 46K new accounts in the period, helping it realize a 12% Y/Y increase in trading activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • FTFT

    SkyPeople Fruit Juice (SPU) +27.1% premarket after its audit firm independently verifies its...

    SkyPeople Fruit Juice (SPU) +27.1% premarket after its audit firm independently verifies its cash balances. SPU investors "can be reassured that our cash balances have been independently verified and that we employ of a high degree of financial integrity in terms of our financial management systems," the Chinese company says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • WOLF

    Premarket gainers: WOLF +7%. AMRN +6%. CPST +6%. BPOP +6%. ETFC +5%. ING +4%. ARNA +4%. HON +4%....

    Premarket gainers: WOLF +7%. AMRN +6%. CPST +6%. BPOP +6%. ETFC +5%. ING +4%. ARNA +4%. HON +4%. DB +4%. SLB +4%. MSFT +3%. DANG +3%. HERO +3%. E +3%.
    Losers: RVBD -26%. TPX -13%. SNDK -13%. EXPD -6%. NOK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.83B (+9.7%...

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.83B (+9.7% Y/Y) beats by $60M. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • ETH

    Ethan Allen (NYSE:ETH) -3.6% premarket after forecasting FQ3 adjusted EPS of $0.13-$0.14, vs....

    Ethan Allen (NYSE:ETH) -3.6% premarket after forecasting FQ3 adjusted EPS of $0.13-$0.14, vs. analyst consensus $0.19, due to expenses related to revamping its product line that hurt profit by $0.04-$0.05. By the end of the fiscal year, the furniture maker says ~60% of its products will be new. ETH raises its quarterly dividend to $0.09 from $0.07.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q1: Global comparable sales +7.3%, led by a 8.9% gain in U.S. In...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q1: Global comparable sales +7.3%, led by a 8.9% gain in U.S. In Europe, 5% sales growth led by performance in U.K. and Russia. Total operating costs and expenses increased 7% Y/Y. Shares +1.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • GSK

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) +1.5% premarket after reaching agreement to divest previously...

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) +1.5% premarket after reaching agreement to divest previously identified non-core OTC brands to Aspen Pharmacare for Â£164M in cash. Brands being divested include Phillips MOM, Solpadeine, Dequadin, Cartia and Zantac, and generated sales of ~Â£60M in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • BPOP

    Popular (NASDAQ:BPOP): Q1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)

    Popular (NASDAQ:BPOP): Q1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q1 EPS of $1.23 in-line. Revenue of $6.55B (+7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q1 EPS of $1.23 in-line. Revenue of $6.55B (+7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • CHK

    A Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) shareholder files a lawsuit against CEO Aubrey McClendon,...

    A Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) shareholder files a lawsuit against CEO Aubrey McClendon, according to reports on CNBC. Shares of CHK -0.3% premarket, -6.1% post-McClendon story.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM | 15 Comments
  • GE

    More on GE's (NYSE:GE) Q1: Revenue gains led by 14% Y/Y increase in Industrial segment to...

    More on GE's (NYSE:GE) Q1: Revenue gains led by 14% Y/Y increase in Industrial segment to $23.7B, offsetting 12% decine in GE Capital. Organic orders up 14%. Free cash generated up 22% to $1.7B. Reports GECC Tier 1 Common Ratio of 10.4%. Shares +0.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • BP

    A DOJ audit finds BP owes $64M in payments related to the Deepwater spill to cover "significant"...

    A DOJ audit finds BP owes $64M in payments related to the Deepwater spill to cover "significant" errors" and shortages in checks sent to 7.3K individuals and businesses affected by the disaster. Shares of BP -2.2% in London trading, -1.1% premarket in U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 AM | 1 Comment
